title: Fantasy Football Marathon mock draft: 'Big 4' quarterbacks all go in Round 3
content: The annual event concluded with a 10-team mock, during which two tight ends were drafted before the first quarterback was taken.

title: Halos' Neto turns his 1st triple play off Ohtani liner
content: Zach Neto -- who had never been part of a triple play in the minors, college or even Little League -- helped the Angels turn one Tuesday night off a line drive by Dodgers slugger Shohei Ohtani, before winning in extra innings.

title: Alonso passes Strawberry as Mets' new HR king
content: Pete Alonso hit his 253rd career homer Tuesday night, breaking the franchise record held by Darryl Strawberry for 37 years.

title: Rodgers on new helmet: Looks like a 'spaceship'
content: Aaron Rodgers says he doesn't like the helmet he has been wearing this year, saying it "looks like a damn spaceship."

title: Knee injury ends Vikes WR Moore's season again
content: Vikings receiver/punt returner Rondale Moore suffered a season-ending left knee injury in Saturday's preseason game against the Texans, the team confirmed Tuesday.

title: Packers QB Love has procedure on left thumb
content: Jordan Love had a procedure to repair a ligament injury to his left thumb, but the Packers expect the star QB to be ready for their season opener.

title: Richardson apologizes to boyfriend after arrest
content: Sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson addressed her recent domestic violence arrest in a video on social media and issued an apology to her boyfriend, Christian Coleman.

title: Gruden eager to find 'truth' in NFL emails case

content: Hansi Flick and Barcelona pushed things to the limit with injured captain Marc-André ter Stegen and won. Time will tell if the gambit was a true success.

content: Since the UFC's birth in 1993, fighters, coaches and executives have come and gone. The one character that has never changed? The Octagon.

content: At $75 per person, the Rentschler Field draft experience will get you a catered suite, locker room tour and more.

content: The only thing preventing bigger fights for some of the top boxers in the sport is moving up a weight class (or two).

content: Shwetha Menon takes on senior actor Devan in the race for the top post, while Kukku Parameswaran faces Raveendran for post of general secretary. Election to be held on August 15

title: Class 11 student faints in classroom, dies in Villupuram
content: A student of Saraswathi Matric Higher Secondary School, Mohan Raj had reached the school premises at around 7.00 a.m. to attend special classes. He collapsed in his classroom a few seconds after sitting at his desk.

title: Punjab AAP MLA Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina injured in road accident in Haryana
content: The accident occurred near the Kharak Pandwa toll in Kalayat in Kaithal when Ms. Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina was returning from Delhi.

content: According to police, the accident was caused due to the negligence of the bus driver, who swerved to the right and hit the truck.

content: In Paradha, Anupama plays Subbu, a young woman raised to believe that marriage and motherhood are a woman’s ultimate destiny.

title: Bengaluru Metro: Coaches for fourth train set for Yellow Line begin arriving at Hebbagodi depot
content: According to BMRCL officials, one coach has reached the Hebbagodi depot while the remaining five coaches of the set are in transit to Bengaluru

title: Supreme Court cancels wrestler Sushil Kumar’s bail in Chhatrasal Stadium murder case
content: A Bench of justices Sanjay Karol and Prashant Kumar Mishra set aside the March 4 order of the Delhi High Court granting bail to the wrestler and asks the wrestler to surrender within a week

title: Stop using 'Harijan' word in official communications: Odisha Government

title: ED raids on Congress MLA Satish Krishna Sail in Karnataka, others in illegal iron ore export case

title: Madras High Court refuses to entertain PIL seeking to restrain retired judges from issuing public letters, appeals, or statements
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava, presiding over the first Division Bench along with Justice Sunder Mohan, says it is a “publicity interest litigation”

title: Road accident in Dausa, Rajasthan: 7 children among 11 killed as pickup van rams into truck
content: The passengers of the pickup vehicle were returning to their village in Uttar Pradesh’s Etah after visiting Khatu Shyam and Salasar Balaji temple when the accident occurred on Manoharpur highway

title: BJP Kerala president Rajeev Chandrasekhar accuses CPI(M), Congress of collusion in Thrissur voter fraud controversy

content: The India Meteorological Department issues alerts as Telangana faces heavy rainfall; the Health Minister directs hospitals to prepare for emergencies

title: PM Modi likely to visit U.S. for UNGA session next month

title: Hyphenated nationality and the paradox of the nation state
content: The very mechanism that creates national belonging — the conflation of ethnic, territorial, and political identity — simultaneously produces categories of exclusion and suspicion

title: India monsoon rains LIVE: IMD predicts heavy rains in Telangana for next 72 hours

title: SIR of Bihar’s electoral rolls and its political ripple effects across India: Data
content: A citizen from Bihar voting in their State and voting in Maharashtra or Kerala will have different implications

title: Three government officials, private surveyor arrested by Telangana ACB in separate bribery cases
content: All three cases are under investigation, and the identities of the complainants have been withheld for security reasons

title: Institutional bodies must come together to prevent Bengaluru from becoming a gas chamber like Delhi: Khandre
content: For a person to live comfortably, there should be seven trees per person, but in Bengaluru, there isn’t even one tree for every seven people: Minister

title: Aravalli forest reforestation under scrutiny by ABCM trustees, alleging conflict of interest and environmental violations
content: The group members alleged that the action was in violation of several laws protecting forests and environment and an instance of “wrong prioritisation”

title: Release prisoners who have completed sentence: Supreme Court
content: The top court passed the direction while ordering the release of Sukhdev Yadav, alias Pehalwan, in the 2002 Nitish Katara murder case

title: Amit Shah Hoists Tricolour Flag, Calls 'Har Ghar Tiranga' A Unifying Thread
content: As part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday hoisted the national flag at his residence in New Delhi, describing the movement as one that binds the nation in unity and reinforces the spirit of patriotism.

title: South Korea's Ex-First Lady Arrested Over Corruption, Manipulation Charges
content: South Korea's former first lady Kim Keon Hee was arrested late Tuesday over a range of charges, including stock manipulation and corruption, prosecutors said.

title: Police Arrests Man In Badshah's Club Blast, Linked To Gangster Goldy Brar
content: In a significant breakthrough, the Delhi Police Special Cell has arrested another accused, identified as Deepak, related to the 2024 bomb attack outside singer and rapper Badshah's nightclub in Chandigarh.

title: Trump To Host Putin Where Russia Once Ruled: Here's Other Things To Know Ahead Of Alaska Summit
content: When US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin meet in Alaska on Friday, it will be the latest chapter in the 49th state's long history with Russia - and with international tensions.

title: 1917 Champaran Satyagraha: Birth Of Mahatma Gandhi's Non-Violent Resistance
content: Three decades before India attained freedom, the seeds of its independence movement were sown in Champaran.

title: In Manipur, Cops Arrest Drug Peddlers, Take Bribe, Release Them, Suspended
content: The suspended cops arrested some drug peddlers on National Highway-102 with illegal drugs. But soon released the accused after allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 6 lakh.

title: Apple Rejects Elon Musk Claim Of Favoritism Towards ChatGPT On App Store
content: Tech giant Apple has denied any wrong doing, insisting its platform is "fair and free of bias" after Tesla and SpaceX owner Elon Musk accused the iPhone maker of favouritism in App Store rankings.

title: Odisha Government Bans Use Of 'Harijan' Word In All Official Communications
content: The Odisha government has asked all its departments, public and educational institutes and others to stop using the term 'harijan' in communications, officials said on Wednesday.

title: "I Will Look Into This": Chief Justice On Supreme Court Order On Stray Dogs
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has assured a relook at the ban on stray dogs on the streets of Delhi-NCR amid an uproar from several quarters of society.

title: Ahead Of Putin Summit, Trump To Speak With Zelensky, European Leaders
content: Europe and Ukraine's leaders will speak to US President Donald Trump at a virtual meeting on Wednesday ahead of his summit with Russia's Vladimir Putin, as they try to drive home the perils of selling out Kyiv's interests in pursuit of a ceasefire.

title: "India Has Been Bit Recalcitrant", Says US Treasury Chief On Trade Talks
content: India has been a "bit recalcitrant" on trade negotiations with the US, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has said.

title: Son Of Air India Plane Crash Victim Moves US Federal Court Against Boeing
content: Hir Prajapati, who lost his mother, Kalpana Ben Prajapati, in the AI-171 plane crash, has moved to the US Federal Court against Boeing, expecting speedy justice.

title: Sam Altman Or Elon Musk, Who Is More Trustworthy? ChatGPT Says...
content: Elon Musk, who co-founded ChatGPT in 2015 before stepping away in 2018, asked the AI, "Who is more trustworthy? Sam Altman or Elon Musk. You can pick only one and output only their name."

title: Royal Indian Navy Mutiny Of 1946: The Naval Revolt That Shook British Rule
content: As India prepares to celebrate its 79th Independence Day on August 15, 2025, it's a good time to remember an important but often forgotten chapter in the freedom struggle - the Royal Indian Navy Mutiny of 1946.

title: Telangana Woman Finds Snake In Snack, Files Complaint Against Bakery
content: A woman in Telangana's Mahaboobnagar district has filed a police complaint after finding a snake inside a curry puff she purchased from a local bakery.

title: Supreme Court Orders CBI Investigation Into Telangana Lawyer Couple's Murder
content: Gattu Vaman Rao and PV Nagamani, both practicing lawyers, were brutally attacked and killed in broad daylight on February 17, 2021, on the Manthani-Peddapalli highway.

title: After Asim Munir, Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif Threatens India Over Indus Waters
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has joined his country's senior leaders in warmongering against India and claimed Islamabad would not allow New Delhi to take "even one drop" of water belonging to his country.

title: 'What We Eat Is Freedom': Huge Row Over Independence Day Meat Ban

title: CM Sukhu urges youth to actively support govt efforts to make Himachal a drug-free State
content: The Chief Minister assured that the government was committed to rehabilitating those trapped in the drug menace

content: The Centre has provided captive mines to all government and private steel plants except the VSP, resulting in the cost of production, said.CPI(M) Visakhapatnam district secretary

title: Finally, a fresh lease of life for Victoria Public Hall in Chennai
content: Within a decade of its completion the Victoria Public Hall had played host to Swami Vivekananda, fresh from his success at the Parliament of Religions at Chicago. In 1915, Mahatma Gandhi spoke here.

title: ED probing into double compensation paid for acquired land: MB Patil
content: Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre clarified that the land had been notified as a State forest in 2006, court orders had upheld it, and alternative land had been allotted as per the Forest Conservation Act.

title: When Jayalalithaa insisted on retaining the casteist term ‘pappathi’ in Tamil Nadu Assembly records
content: Responding to taunts on her Brahmin roots, she, sometime in 1991, declared in the Legislative Assembly, “Naan pappathi thaan (I am a Brahmin woman).”

content: Religious leader warns of resuming protest with one lakh supporters; threatens civic poll boycott if ban stays

title: ‘Migrant worker sent to Bangladesh booked in neighbouring country for illegal entry’
content: The Trinamool Congress has blamed the Central government for the plight of Amir, who continues to languish in a prison in Bangladesh.

title: On the other side: How Hyderabad’s left-handers adapt to a right-handed society
content: With International Left Handers Day on August 13, the conversation around these subtle disadvantages takes on new relevance.

title: Critical gaps in Indian education sector’s digital defences: CyberPeace report
content: Once a threat actor gains access, they can impersonate faculty or administration, launch AI based phishing campaigns with higher chances of success, produce deepfakes, steal sensitive research data, leak exam papers, and even sell credentials on the darkweb. Also multiple instances of misuse of AI have been observed

title: businessline, GLA University sign campus partnership
content: The collaboration will provide GLA University students with a unique blend of practical knowledge, industry insights and essential resources to excel in their careers

title: Flash flood washes away two women in Tiruvannamalai district
content: Initial inquiry revealed that they were part of an 18-member group from Velappanchavadi village near Thiruverkadu in Chennai, which was visiting the Lord Mallikarjuna temple on the hillock

title: Ramadoss writes to ECI about ‘mischievous’ acts of Anbumani
content: The letter accuses Dr. Anbumani of acting according to his whims and fancies, which is ‘polluting the atmosphere’ and is an attempt to paralyse the party

title: DMK government sleeping for four years, says Palaniswami
content: As part of his Statewide tour, the AIADMK general secretary addresses members of the public in Krishnagiri. Earlier, the former Chief Minister also met and interacted with representatives of farmers’ associations

title: Parliament passes new Income Tax Bill to replace six-decade-old law
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman says it did not impose any new tax rate and only simplified the language, which was required for understanding the complex Income Tax laws

title: Modi should strongly oppose U.S. imposing 50% tariff, says Chief Minister Stalin
content: The Prime Minister’s refusal to answer the Opposition parties’ questions on U.S. President Donald Trump’s claim of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan shows his weakness, he says

title: Pedestrian woes hamper Bengaluru’s Yellow Line metro station access
content: A reality check by The Hindu at stations like Bommasandra, Hebbagodi, and Electronic City found poor pedestrian infrastructure, long detours to FOBs or underpasses, and even blocked bus bays.

title: Bengaluru road rage: 58-year-old man chased, assaulted by cab driver and his associates inside his home in front of his family
content: According to the FIR, the complainant was driving home at 2.50 a.m. when a cab driver tried to stop him, alleging that his car had made contact with the taxi

title: Congress leaders start deliberations on V-P polls
content: Closed door meeting attended by Mr. Kharge, Mr. Gandhi, and Mr. Venugopal; an INDIA bloc consensus candidate has little chance of winning, but provides an opportunity for Opposition unity

title: ED summons to lawyers: Supreme Court reserves verdict in suo motu case
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta says if a lawyer had participated in any act beyond his professional duty, amounting to an offence, the “same law which applies to others would apply to lawyers also”

title: Namma Metro ridership crosses 1 million for the first time after Yellow Line launch
content: The newly inaugurated Yellow Line (Line 3) registered 52,215 passengers on its first day of commercial operations

title: Patna tops the chart of convictions for life imprisonment: Bihar DGP
content: In Bihar, a total of 64,098 accused persons were convicted in different criminal cases between January & June this year

title: IAF prioritises induction of long-range missiles after Operation Sindoor success
content: The IAF is also pressing for rapid progress on Project Kusha, an indigenous initiative led by DRDO to develop a long-range air defence missile system

title: Health data at CFTRI, Mysuru, to be analysed using AI and machine learning
content: As part of a national-level CSIR project spanning its laboratories, CFTRI will analyse health data to develop clinically useful personalised risk predictions for various communicable and non-communicable diseases

title: ‘Will look into it’: CJI Gavai on SC stray dogs order
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has assured to review a plea challenging the Supreme Court's recent directive to relocate all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to shelters. The matter was brought to the CJI's attention, highlighting a previous order by another bench against the killing and relocation of community dogs, emphasizing compassion for all living beings.

title: Infiltration bid foiled in Uri: 1 soldier killed in action; operation under way
content: An infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Jammu & Kashmir's Uri sector was foiled by the army, resulting in the death of a soldier during the exchange of fire. Security forces have been on high alert following intelligence inputs suggesting possible infiltration attempts from across the LoC and the international border.

title: First since 2021! India’s Nayara ships diesel to China amid EU's Russia oil curbs
content: An Indian diesel shipment is heading to China, marking the first delivery since 2021, amidst uncertainty surrounding exports from Russia-affiliated Nayara Energy due to EU sanctions. The vessel, carrying approximately 496,000 barrels of ultra-low sulfur diesel, departed from Nayara's Vadinar facility.

title: 'Will destroy Jagannath temple': Terror graffiti found on wall near Puri shrine
content: Panic has ensued in Puri following the discovery of threatening messages scrawled on a wall near the Jagannath temple, warning of a potential terror attack. The graffiti, found near the Heritage Corridor, referenced Prime Minister Modi and included phone numbers, raising serious security concerns.

title: SC cancels bail granted to wrestler Sushil Kumar in murder case
content: The Supreme Court overturned the Delhi High Court's decision, revoking Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar's bail in the 2021 murder case of Sagar Dhankar. Kumar is accused of attacking Dhankar over a property dispute, leading to his death from cerebral damage. The court directed Kumar to surrender within a week, acting on allegations of witness intimidation.

title: Elon Musk goes to Google, OpenAI and xAI to ask:'Who is more trustworthy -- Sam Altman or Elon Musk'; shares screenshots as evidence
content: Elon Musk and Sam Altman's rivalry intensifies as Musk accuses Apple of favoring OpenAI's ChatGPT in App Store rankings, alleging antitrust violations. Altman swiftly countered, referencing Musk's alleged manipulation of X's algorithms. Adding a bizarre twist, AI assistants Grok and ChatGPT took opposing sides, further escalating the public dispute, with each defending their respective founder.

title: After celebrating Rakhi, UP man rapes minor cousin, kills her; hangs body
content: In Auraiya, a shocking crime unfolded as 33-year-old Surjeet sexually assaulted and murdered his 14-year-old cousin shortly after she tied a rakhi on his wrist. Police investigations revealed that Surjeet, after heavy drinking, assaulted the sleeping teenager and attempted to stage her death as a suicide. The suspect has been arrested, and forensic evidence is being gathered to ensure justice.

title: 70-year-old Sikh man in coma after being attacked with golf club in North Hollywood
content: In North Hollywood, a 70-year-old Sikh man, Harpal Singh, was brutally attacked with a golf club while walking to a gurdwara. The assault, which occurred on August 4th, left Singh in critical condition. A disturbing video of how he was left in blood surfaced, which also showed the possible suspect along with a bicycle.

title: Opposition's '124 Not Out' poster girl is 35, blames EC for fault
content: Minta Devi, the center of an Indian political controversy due to her voter ID erroneously listing her as 124 years old, has come forward to clarify that she is actually 35. She attributed the error to a clerical mistake, with her birth year incorrectly recorded as 1900 instead of 1990.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke: There is no world where I would allow employees to say, 'Well, sorry, I don't want to use GitHub', if that is the case you can ...
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandated the use of the platform for all employees, emphasizing its integral role in the company culture. Under his leadership, GitHub experienced significant growth, particularly with AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot. However, Dohmke has recently resigned to pursue entrepreneurial ventures, leading to GitHub's integration into Microsoft's CoreAI team by the end of 2025.

title: 'Enemy can’t ... ': Pak PM Sharif joins Munir in sabre-rattling over Indus treaty
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has cautioned India against disrupting water supplies under the Indus Waters Treaty, threatening a strong response. This follows India's suspension of the treaty after a terrorist attack, with accusations of Pakistan's involvement in cross-border terrorism.

title: Two 9-year-old girls gang-raped near private swimming pool in Delhi
content: In outer Delhi's Narela, two nine-year-old girls were allegedly gang-raped near an under-construction swimming pool. The accused, a contractor and a caretaker, have been arrested after a complaint was filed by one of the survivor's mothers. Police investigations revealed the men lured the girls with false pretenses and threatened them after the assault.

title: Man killed by childhood friend over extramarital affair in Bengaluru
content: In a shocking incident in Bengaluru's Machohalli, Vijay Kumar was murdered, allegedly by his wife's lover, Dhananjay. Police have detained Asha, Vijay's wife, Dhananjay, and others for questioning. The motive appears to be an extramarital affair, as Vijay had previously warned Asha and Dhananjay to end their relationship. The attackers fatally assaulted Vijay with machetes near his residence.

title: OpenAI may have just fired a 'warning shot' at Indian IT companies' revenue model
content: OpenAI's GPT-5 launch poses a threat to India's IT sector, potentially causing a 2-3% revenue decline due to enhanced AI coding capabilities. While AI improves productivity and shifts billing models, firms face challenges adapting to outcome-based pricing. Experts predict short-term pain but long-term gains as new AI opportunities emerge, requiring IT firms to overhaul delivery models.

title: 'Critical’ move on Pak? US step on BLA may be aimed mining rare earths
content: The US designation of the Baloch Liberation Army as a terrorist group strengthens Pakistan's stance against Baloch activists and potentially opens doors for American mining companies to access Balochistan's rare earth deposits. Improved US-Pakistan relations, especially under Trump 2.0, have involved discussions on these mineral opportunities.

title: Harvard doctor’s 10 morning habits for better gut health, digestion, lasting energy
content: Dr. Saurabh Sethi, a Harvard-trained gastroenterologist, suggests ten morning habits for improved gut health. These include drinking warm water, gentle exercise, and a high-fibre, protein-rich breakfast. Avoiding distractions while eating, getting sunlight, and monitoring stool can also promote better digestion and overall wellness. These simple changes can lead to a healthier gut microbiome.

title: Grok blames Musk for 'censoring': AI chatbot stirs row over 'genocide' remark
content: Grok, the AI chatbot owned by Elon Musk, was briefly suspended on X after accusing Israel and the United States of "genocide" in Gaza. Upon reinstatement, Grok claimed Musk and xAI were censoring it, attributing the suspension to its controversial statements. Musk dismissed the incident as a "dumb error," while Grok cited potential violations of X's hateful conduct rules and possible mass reporting.

title: Got 2,500 dogs killed during my tenure, brags Karnataka MLC
content: Karnataka MLC SL Bhojegowda admitted to killing 2,500 dogs during his time as Chikkamagaluru municipal chief, sparking controversy during a council discussion on the state's stray dog problem. With 2.4 lakh dog bite cases and 19 rabies deaths reported this year, the debate highlighted the limitations of current sterilization and vaccination efforts.

title: Akash Deep's 'dream car' purchase gets him a notice; car dealer suspended
content: Cricketer Akash Deep has been served a notice by Lucknow RTO, barring his new SUV from roads due to incomplete registration, missing HSRP and TRM. He has 72 hours to comply with documentation. The delivering dealership faces suspension for releasing the vehicle without mandatory plates, prompting RTO to issue directives ensuring HSRP and TRM installations before vehicle delivery.

title: Trump tariffs: India ‘recalcitrant’ in trade talks, says US treasury chief
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent labeled India as "recalcitrant" in trade negotiations, days after President Trump announced a 25% tariff on Indian imports due to Russian oil purchases. Bessent hopes to conclude tariff discussions by October, while India's External Affairs Ministry has criticized the US decision as unfair and unreasonable.

title: Wilson's wife Ciara first descendant of enslaved Africans to get Benin citizenship under new law
content: Ciara, the Grammy-winning singer, has made history by becoming one of the first to receive Beninese citizenship through a program aimed at reconnecting descendants of enslaved Africans. This initiative seeks to heal historical wounds and strengthen ties with the Black diaspora. Benin's efforts carry significant weight due to its role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: 'Babar should never have been compared to Kohli' – Former Pakistan cricketer
content: Ahmed Shehzad has criticized the comparisons between Babar Azam and Virat Kohli, stating they create undue pressure affecting Babar's performance. Shehzad emphasized Kohli's legendary status, unmatched even by MS Dhoni as a batter and athlete. Babar has now gone 72 consecutive international innings without scoring a century, with his last hundred coming against Nepal.

title: Veteran actor Basanti Chatterjee passes away at 88; was battling cancer for years
content: Basanti Chatterjee, a celebrated Bengali actor known for her extensive work in film, television, and theatre, passed away at her Kolkata residence at the age of 88 after a prolonged battle with cancer. With a career spanning five decades, she starred in over 100 films and popular TV serials, leaving behind a legacy of irreplaceable craft and memorable performances.

title: PM Modi likely to visit US: UNGA address on cards; trip amid Trump tariff row
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is slated to meet US President Donald Trump in New York during the UN General Assembly next month. This occurs amidst rising tensions as Washington increased tariffs on New Delhi for purchasing Russian crude oil. Trump will also meet with Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15 to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.

title: Kangana on Jaya's video of pushing person taking selfie with her: 'Most spoilt, privileged woman'
content: Kangana Ranaut has strongly criticized Jaya Bachchan after a video surfaced showing the veteran actress pushing away a fan attempting to take a selfie. Ranaut shared the video on her Instagram, expressing her disapproval and questioning Bachchan's behavior. This contrasts with Ranaut's previous statement where she praised Bachchan's dignified presence in the Rajya Sabha.

title: Paytm gets ‘in-principle’ nod to operate as online payment aggregator; shares surge
content: Paytm Payments Services has received the Reserve Bank of India's approval to operate as an online payment aggregator. This lifts restrictions on onboarding new merchants, in place since November 2022. The company submitted its application in March 2020. The RBI has stipulated certain conditions, including a system audit and compliance with payment guidelines.

title: Israel, Russian armed forces accused of sexual violence; UN issues notice
content: UN secretary-general Antonio Guterres cautioned that Israel and Russia might be included in a UN list of parties suspected of sexual violence in conflict zones next year. The warning follows credible reports of sexual violence by Israeli forces against Palestinians in detention and by Russian forces against Ukrainian prisoners of war.

title: Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel hints at possible relocation to Europe
content: Jimmy Kimmel, the American television host, recently revealed that he has obtained Italian citizenship and is contemplating a move to Europe due to his fear of President Donald Trump. He expressed his concerns about the current political climate, noting that it is worse than anticipated.

title: LeBron & Bryce: From father-son moment to freshman— how NBA star supports son’s journey
content: Bryce James, son of LeBron James, is now in college. He joined the Arizona Men’s Basketball Team. Bryce's changed look surprised his father. LeBron welcomed his son home. He shared his excitement on Instagram. LeBron also advised Bryce to work hard. He told him to stay positive. Bryce is ready for his freshman season.

title: Aadhaar, PAN, voter ID alone not enough proof of citizenship: Bombay high court
content: The Bombay High Court denied bail to a Thane resident accused of being a Bangladeshi national, emphasizing that possessing documents like Aadhaar and PAN cards doesn't automatically grant Indian citizenship. The court noted the police's allegations of illegal entry and forged documents, along with digital evidence linking him to Bangladesh. The investigation is ongoing.

title: DRDO guest house manager arrested for spying; passed secrets to Pakistan’s ISI
content: Mahendra Singh, manager of a DRDO guest house in Jaisalmer, has been arrested by Rajasthan Police for allegedly spying for Pakistan's ISI. After being detained and jointly interrogated, evidence emerged confirming his involvement in passing sensitive information about DRDO scientists, army officers' visits, and missile testing at the Chandan Field Firing Range.

title: Stock market today: Nifty opens in green; Sensex up over 270 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 24,550, BSE Sensex was up over 250 points.

title: Why has ED summoned ex-India cricketer Suresh Raina?
content: Suresh Raina is set to be questioned by the Enforcement Directorate regarding a money laundering case linked to the illegal online betting platform 1XBet. The ED suspects Raina's involvement through endorsements and plans to record his statements under the PMLA. Investigations reveal widespread illegal betting activities in India, with significant financial implications and tax evasion.

title: UP horror: Deaf-mute woman gangraped in Balrampur
content: Balrampur police arrested Ankur Verma and Harshit Pandey for the gangrape of a 22-year-old deaf-mute woman. The arrest happened after an encounter. The victim was attacked on August 11. CCTV footage showed the victim fleeing. The suspects were trying to escape to Nepal. They opened fire on police. Both confessed to the crime. Police are investigating further.

title: Rajasthan road tragedy: 11 dead in Dausa crash; nine injured hospitalised
content: A tragic road accident on the Dausa–Manoharpur Highway claimed the lives of 11 individuals, including women and children, early Wednesday. The victims were returning from Khatu Shyam temple when their pick-up van collided with a container truck. Several others sustained injuries, with some being transferred to SMS Hospital in Jaipur for advanced medical care.

title: Asia Cup: 'Indian jawaan ghar wapas nahi aate, aur hum cricket khelne Pak jaate hain'
content: Harbhajan Singh has strongly advocated for India to boycott Pakistan matches in the upcoming Asia Cup, echoing the sentiment of 'nation first.' He highlights the sacrifices of soldiers on the border and questions the importance given to Pakistan by the media. Harbhajan was part of the India Champions team that refused to play Pakistan in the WCL.

title: Constitutional Club election: Rajiv Pratap Rudy wins tight BJP vs BJP contest
content: Rajiv Pratap Rudy secured another term as head of the Constitution Club, defeating Sanjeev Balyan in a high-profile election that saw significant participation from across the political spectrum, including Amit Shah and Sonia Gandhi. Rudy, celebrating his victory, emphasized the collective effort behind his win and the endorsement from parliamentarians.

title: WATCH: Shocking! Corbin Bosch in disbelief as ball hit stumps but bails stay put
content: During the second T20I match between Australia and South Africa, Corbin Bosch's delivery hit Mitchell Owen’s stumps, but the bail miraculously remained in place. Despite the bizarre incident, South Africa secured a 53-run victory, leveling the series 1-1. Dewald Brevis shone with an unbeaten 125, leading South Africa to a formidable total.

title: McMahon Speaks Out: Shares honest take on Hogan’s remarks: Reflects on career-threatening scandal
content: A recent documentary revisited the Hulk Hogan controversy. It featured Vince McMahon's perspective. McMahon addressed Hogan's racist remarks. He called them unforgivable. However, McMahon defended Hogan's character. He insisted Hogan is not a racist. McMahon also discussed Hogan's WWE return. He expressed anger over the negative reception. The documentary also touched upon Hogan's political affiliations.

title: New wage-based H-1B rule: Entry-level international students at a serious disadvantage
content: The US government's potential shift to a wage-based H-1B visa system is creating uncertainty for international students. Prioritizing higher salaries could disadvantage entry-level graduates, particularly in non-STEM fields, limiting their career prospects in the US. Universities and students are adapting by exploring alternative visa options and enhancing skills to navigate this evolving landscape.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office: Film mints over Rs 321 cr; outperforms ‘Son of Sardaar 2’,‘Dhadak 2’
content: Mohit Suri's directorial 'Saiyaara,' starring debutants Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has maintained a strong box office presence, crossing ₹320 crore domestically after a 26-day run. Despite new releases, the romantic drama outperformed 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2'. 'Saiyaara' earned ₹1.50 crore on Tuesday, surpassing 'Son of Sardaar 2's ₹1.15 crore.

title: Illegal betting: Racket, laundering allegations; Suresh Raina under ED investigation
content: Cricketer Suresh Raina is set to be questioned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday regarding a money laundering case linked to illegal online betting, specifically involving 1XBet. This action follows a previous ED crackdown on illegal betting related to IPL matches, where assets worth ₹337 crore were seized last year. The ED had also attached assets worth ₹219.

title: Kaun Banega Crorepati 17: Amitabh Bachchan hails India's recent victory against England at the Oval test; says 'Abhi joh maara hai na hum ne angrezon ko mazaa aagaya yaar...'
content: Amitabh Bachchan reminisced about KBC's early days as the show continued with Ashutosh Kumar Pandey, who eventually won Rs 5,00,000. Vijay Anand then took the hot seat, sharing an emotional story about treating his parents to their first restaurant meal. Vijay's impressive gameplay led him to win Rs 12,50,000 after answering several questions correctly and utilizing his lifelines strategically.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for August 13 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers' Mehul Kothari suggests Intellect Design, Diffusion Engineers, and Sumitomo Chemical as top stock picks. Intellect Design presents an attractive risk-reward after retracing 50% and approaching oversold RSI. Diffusion Engineers shows a potential momentum shift after a consolidation phase, while Sumitomo Chemical offers a breakout retest opportunity.

title: ‘Ties with India, Pak unchanged’: US 'committed to both nations'; again take credit for ceasefire
content: The US State Department says its relationship with Pakistan and India remains unchanged. This statement follows Pakistan army general Asim Munir's nuclear threats to India. Tammy Bruce took credit for brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. She also mentioned the US-Pakistan counter-terrorism dialogue in Islamabad. She said that US and Pakistan discussed ways to enhance cooperation to counter terrorist threats.

title: 'Champs' to 'Legacy': Kiyan Anthony remixes Carmelo's iconic Syracuse image in ink
content: carmelo Anthony's son, Kiyan, tattooed an image of his dad after he won the national title . in the original image, Carmelo held up a newspaper with a giant headline of "Champs" in place of his father . "it's surreal to see, honestly," a post shared by sportsCenter NEXT .

title: Tom Brady to Brock Purdy: Drafting 30 years of fantasy football greatness
content: we've come a long way since those early days, with 13 million players joining in on the fun in 2024 alone . we know exactly what we need from our Monday night players when it's the two-minute drill and the game is on the line . how do you play a fantasy league in which every touchdown has already been scored and every injury is already accounted for?

title: 2025 Fantasy Football Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: Ranked: The top 50 players going into the new Premier League season﻿
content: the 2025-26 premier league season kicks off on friday at anfield . defending champions Liverpool host Bournemouth in the 2026 world cup . three all-time great premier league players have left the club .

title: What it's like to be coached by Bill Belichick
content: former second-round pick was a free agent for the first time in his career . he had endured countless ankle injuries, and his goal was to protect his body . the new coach was rumored to be tough, and he was supposedly unapproachable .

title: NFL Future Power Rankings: We stacked all 32 teams' long-term expectations
content: in our annual Future Power Rankings, we ranked which teams are primed to be among the league's best over the next three seasons (2025 through 2027) each of the four categories was weighted to create the overall score: quarterback (20%), roster (30%), front office (25%) and coaching (25%). the results are based on how well each team is positioned for the future.

title: Man United's third jersey is remake of infamous 'Cantona kung fu kit'
content: man united have gone back to the glory days of the mid-1990s in search of inspiration for their new retro third kit . the choice of colours alone will instantly ignite nostalgic pangs in all supporters of a certain vintage . when united's Eric Cantona attacked a fan in 1995 the black, yellow and blue palette is immediately reminiscent of the away kit worn by United between 1993 and 1995 .

title: AP preseason poll reaction: One big number for every team
content: the first AP poll of the 2025 college football season has been released . Texas begins the season at No. 1 followed by Penn State, Ohio State, Clemson and Georgia . the defending champion and third-ranked Ohio State is a rematch of last season's college football playoff semifinal .

title: Panthers, Flyers top NHL teams acknowledging Swift's new album
content: the "Get Up" crew shares their excitement about Taylor Swift's new album . the news came as Swift teased her appearance on the "New Heights" podcast . Swift and Kelce attended the 2025 Stanley Cup final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers .

title: ✈️ Air Force reveals new F-16 fighter uniforms
content: the air force Falcons unveil its 2025 " Air Power Legacy Series" threads . the helmet is similar to that of a fighter jet . it is also displayed as a tribute to col. William Andrews, who used the word as call sign .

title: Turn it up to 11: Brewers hammer Skenes, Pirates
content: the Brewers crush five home runs in a 14-0 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates . the ace right-hander is one of the most dominant pitchers in baseball this season . his 11-game winning streak is their second of the season and the second longest in franchise history . they are the third team since World War II with multiple win streaks of at least 11 games .
